author: Ryan G
title: confuse about "You must not use the built-in function member"
question:
“You must not use the built-in function member”
could someone explain to me what this means, please?
student_answer:
'member' is also one of bulit in function
You can find it on help desk
instructor_answer: BSL has a built-in function called member, which takes an arbitrary value and a list and returns whether the value is in the list. This instruction means that, for the problem in question, we explicitly don't want you to use it.
